en.academic-0:
According to the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated June 20, 2017, No. 393, on the approval of regulations for admission to higher education institutions, transfer, reinstatement, and expulsion of students, applications are accepted annually from July 15 to August 5 (inclusive).

Transferring studies from foreign and non-state universities in Uzbekistan:

1) For related and similar fields, passing a test or creative exam and achieving a passing score is required.
2) If the passing score is not achieved, transfer is allowed under super-contract terms;
3) For non-related and non-similar fields, transfer is possible without an exam by paying a one-time 'super-contract.'

Transfer from a state university to a non-state university
This is not regulated by the state; the procedure is independently determined by non-state universities. Check with the specific non-state university for transfer possibilities.

Transfer within one state university from one field or faculty to another
This issue is reviewed by the university rector, and the application is submitted to the rector (not via transfer.edu.uz or my.uzbmb.uz). Factors such as the compatibility of the field, reasons for transfer, university resources, and other factors may be considered.

Changing the form or language of study within one university and field
This issue is also resolved by the university administration. The purpose of the transfer, university capacity (e.g., classroom size, number of professors, etc.), and other factors may be considered.

Applications are accepted as follows:

transfer.edu.uz â€” for transfers between state universities or within one university;

my.uzbmb.uz â€” for transfers from foreign and non-state universities to state universities.
Required documents:
â—¾ï¸ application (online);
â—¾ï¸ transcript or grade book (JPEG or PDF format);
â—¾ï¸ academic certificate (for those being reinstated).
